justification: "To measure participants' perceptions of group moral foundations, we used a modified version of the MFQ (Graham et al., 2009). Participants completed a 32-item questionnaire…"
The same 32-item modified MFQ was used to obtain scores for the fairness foundation along with the other moral domains.
The authors report that participants’ ‘loyalty’ scores were derived from the modified MFQ, indicating this scale was the measurement tool for that construct.
Authority ratings were among the Moral Foundation Scores obtained from the 32-item modified MFQ administered four times to each participant.
Purity was one of the five Moral Foundation Scores produced by the modified MFQ, as noted when the authors discuss reliability and results for the ‘purity’ foundation.

measured_by: Single-item self-report political orientation question (liberal / moderate / conservative)
justification: "Political orientation was measured and controlled for in the analysis," with participants classifying themselves as liberal, moderate, or conservative.

measured_by: 7-point Likert items assessing warmth and related traits
justification: In the follow-up check, participants rated ingroups on "warmth" (M = 5.69, SD = 1.16) using items that asked about warmth, trust, etc., on a 7-point scale.

measured_by: 7-point Likert items assessing competence and related traits
justification: The same follow-up measurement included a competence item (M = 5.43, SD = 1.29) on the 7-point scale, showing competence was measured with those items.
